Text.text: You can add custom content to the header of the list report. This content is added above the filter bar.
The example below shows three tiles added to the header controlling the filtering of items in the list report and the execution of actions.
Depending on the way the header is shown (expanded or collapsed) different fragments are used showing either controls of type GenericTile or KPITag.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Fragment settings in the Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: You can specify separate Fragments in the manifest.json file for the expanded header and the collapsed header as shown in the sample code.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Fragment definition for the expanded header
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Controls of type GenericTile with its properties and press-handlers are used to show the tiles for the List Report header.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Fragment definition for the collapsed header
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: For the collapsed header KPITag macros are used to show the KPI tags.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Extensions settings in the Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: The controller used for the extension is defined in the extensions section of the manifest file.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Controller implementation
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: The Controller implementation used to set the filtering and to handle the press-event for the action to be triggered.
